014package org.jdbi.v3.core.argument;
015
016import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
020
021/**
022 * Represents an argument to a prepared statement. It will be called right before the
023 * statement is executed to bind the parameter.
024 *
025 * Make sure to override {@link Object#toString} if you want to be able to log values with an {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.SqlLogger}.
026 */
027@FunctionalInterface
028public interface Argument {
029    /**
030     * Apply the argument to the given prepared statement.
031     *
032     * @param position the position to which the argument should be bound, using the
033     *                 stupid JDBC "start at 1" bit
034     * @param statement the prepared statement the argument is to be bound to
035     * @param ctx the statement context
036     * @throws SQLException if anything goes wrong
037     */
038    void apply(int position, PreparedStatement statement, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException;
039}
